New Records: Nikola Jokic had the 145th career triple-double with 35 points, 15 assists, and 12 rebounds.
Russell Westbrook had the 202nd career triple-double with 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Key Match Events: Pascal Siakam had 25 points with 10 rebounds, Tyrese Haliburton matched his 25 points with 10 assists, and the Indiana Pacers took care of the Golden State Warriors 108-96.
Giannis Antetokounmpo had 41 points and 14 rebounds and Milwaukee beat Orlando in spite of 34 points by the Magic’s Paolo Banchero in his long-awaited return from an injury.
Damian Lillard added 29 points for the Bucks, including a couple of free throws with 9.3 seconds left for the game’s final points.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Steve Kerr said Green was bothered by a back injury and Curry had a bad knee.
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana took control with a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied at 76 after three quarters. Sacramento then took command, opening the fourth on a 24-9 run to take a 100-85 lead with 6:03 to play.

The Bulls spotted their guests the opening basket but took the lead for good a few possessions later. Up 68-58 at halftime, they turned the game into a rout with a 9-0 run midway through the third quarter.
Others: Buddy Hield had 17 points for the Warriors, Pat Spencer scored a season high 17 as the Warriors sat six players on their second game in two nights.
The victory extended Sacramento’s season-high win streak to six games.
